page.title: 10Transport in Broadwindsor
page.content: Most children who go to Broadwindsor Primary School go by bus. Two buses run in the morning and afternoon. Most people in this area travel by car. Buses run to Bridport every Wednesday and Saturday morning from Broadwindsor square. A bus also runs to Crewkerne every Thursday. Every day milk tankers pass through the village. Lorries carrying food and cattle pass often. Children often ride their bikes on the roads and lanes. Also tractors and other farm machinary go through Broadwindsor and places near. Motorbikes and mopeds ride through the village.
